alert.note: Alert for Durham; Franklin; Granville; Vance; Wake; Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 8:51PM EST until January 09 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Durham County in central North Carolina... Franklin County in central North Carolina... Granville County in central North Carolina... Vance County in central North Carolina... Wake County in central North Carolina... Warren County in central North Carolina... * Until 1000 PM EST. * At 851 PM EST, Heavy rain has ended across the area, but continued runoff is still leading to rises on many creeks and streams mainly over Wake County. Flood waters area expected to recede within the next hour. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Raleigh, Durham, Cary, Henderson, Oxford, Creedmoor, Louisburg, Warrenton, Wake Forest, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Butner, Zebulon, Franklinton, Norlina, Littleton, Kittrell, Bunn, RDU International and Apex. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Durham; Franklin; Granville; Vance; Wake; Warren
